parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From a compound of hudor and a derivative of pino; to be a water-drinker, i.e. To abstain from vinous beverages.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To use, make use of, deal with, take advantage of.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The stomach. From stoma; an orifice, i.e., the 'stomach'.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Frequent, often, much. From the same as skenopoios; clasped, i.e. frequent; neuter plural frequently.
From asthenes; feebleness; by implication, malady; morally, frailty.
